16c08245-7015-45fc-aee1-24892ce53688.description: Earners of the CIFP (Certified Investment Financial Professional) designation are able to display competency in finance, credit and investment governance related topics. badge_template_activities.title: Entry Requirement: The program is ideally suited for those involved in the financial management of growing organizations, or those who are working to support them. Specifically, this includes, borrowing firms seeking or managing external credit investments, development Funds under National Development Fund (NDF) and enabling organizations (those providing regional or industry specific support or incentives).

Prerequisites: Candidates must complete the Foundation Level of the CIFP program which includes completing:  approximately 25 hours of eLearning, 2 final assessments and a requirement of minimum 70% pass mark to qualify for the Intermediate Phase.

Achievement Criteria: To earn a badge and certification for the Intermediate Phase candidates must complete a minimum of 4 eLearning courses (up to 20 hours of learning), attend 5 days of virtual instructor-led training (3 courses) and receive a minimum of 70% pass mark in all 7 courses.

0fc3dc25-ba37-41da-aa7c-4d7096dba5b4.description: The Standard Chartered-INSEAD Wealth Academy is a high powered partnership between two leaders in their own space with a strong presence in Asia and the Middle East markets. The Academy’s HNW (High Net Worth) Programme aims to upskill the Bank’s Priority Private Relationship Teams (Relationship Managers and Wealth Specialists) and nurture them to become future-ready advisors - providing timely, personalised and high-quality differentiated wealth advice and sophisticated solutions to our clients.
0fc3dc25-ba37-41da-aa7c-4d7096dba5b4.name: Standard Chartered - INSEAD Wealth Academy High Net Worth Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The Academy’s HNW (High Net Worth) Programme aims to upskill the Bank’s Priority Private Relationship Teams (Relationship Managers and Wealth Specialists) and nurture them to become future-ready advisors - providing timely, personalised and high-quality differentiated wealth advice and sophisticated solutions to our clients.

The programme includes a well-structured multi-step journey focused on deeper client engagement, knowledge of advanced wealth products, imbibing advisory architecture, and eventually concluding with an INSEAD-led module to hone their understanding of market nuances and understanding the behavioural biases at play.

All candidates qualifying to be on this track possess the necessary certifications and eligibility to advise HNW clients and provide advise / recommendations, as applicable, on all relevant products, before even embarking on their wealth academy journey.

The candidates undertake 80 hours of self-paced and instructor-led training co-created by Standard Chartered, Fitch Learning and INSEAD. All participants go through a range of online assessments and navigate through real-life case scenarios and simulation-based practices and assessments individually and in groups, before they qualify for certification. This training aims to equip participants with robust advisory-led client conversations that lead to more effective outcomes for our clients.

Achievement Criteria - To earn a badge and certification for the HNW track, candidates must complete all available modules and achieve a minimum score of 70% pass mark across all available assignments
